tool.name: CreateViewshed

param.name: demLayer
param.dialogReference: Input digital elevation model (DEM). Assumed to be in a spatial reference using metric units (meters). The spatial reference should match spatial reference of the viewed landscape polygon feature produced by the Create Viewed Landscape Polygons tool.
param.pythonReference: Input digital elevation model (DEM). Assumed to be in a spatial reference using metric units (meters). The spatial reference should match spatial reference of the viewed landscape polygon feature produced by the Create Viewed Landscape Polygons tool.

param.name: viewpointSource
param.dialogReference:
Source viewpoint table from the Enjoy the View master database.

Use Database Connections\ETV_on_INP2300VIRMASQL_ETV_Reader.sde\ETV.web.ViewBearings
param.pythonReference:
Source viewpoint table from the Enjoy the View master database.

Use Database Connections\ETV_on_INP2300VIRMASQL_ETV_Reader.sde\ETV.web.ViewBearings

param.name: parkToExtract
param.dialogReference: Park unit code derived from Viewpoint source table.
param.pythonReference: Park unit code derived from Viewpoint source table.

param.name: viewDist
param.pythonReference: Output viewshed distance, in meters. Default: 40000 (40km).

tool.summary:
Given a DEM and viewpoints from the Enjoy the View master database, creates observer points from viewpoints, viewsheds for each observer point, a visible areas raster and polygon feature class and finally, a visibility by observer raster.

The output spatial reference is inherited from the input DEM which should match spatial reference of the viewed landscape polygon feature produced by the Create Viewed Landscape Polygons tool.

This tool may take an hour or more to run if a higher resolution DEM and/or more than 15 viewpoints are used as inputs.

Please note, this tool assumes the Enjoy the View database records contain values for scenic quality and view importance. These data are used to create the composite scenic inventory ratings output.

Tool outputs:

  • Binary viewshed raster for each viewpoint

  • Visible areas (combined) raster

  • Visible areas (combined) polygon feature class

  • Visible areas (by observer point) with composite scenic inventory rating and view count

  • Visibility by observer raster (if viewpoint count < 17)
